CSSText-overflow.summary: The text-overflow CSS property sets how hidden overflow content is signaled to users. It can be clipped, display an ellipsis ('â€¦'), or display a custom string.

remarks.para: The text-overflow property doesn't force an overflow to occur. To make text overflow its container, you have to set other CSS properties: overflow and white-space. For example:
The text-overflow property only affects content that is overflowing a block container element in its inline progression direction (not text overflowing at the bottom of a box, for example).

-Related CSS properties: overflow, white-space
-CSS properties that control line breaks in words: overflow-wrap, word-break
